events.message: The customer reported their car was involved in a collision at an intersection yesterday evening.
After initial review, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the vehicle collision details.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the car accident claim and coordinate further steps.
The customer received official acknowledgment of their submitted claim for their vehicle accident.
Request sent for accident photos, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report.
Investigation team began analyzing collected evidence related to the collision and claim validity.
The investigation concluded confirming the collision details and liability for the vehicle accident claim.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the extent of the damage and policy coverage for the accident.
The customer expressed dissatisfaction with the initial settlement offer amount for the vehicle repair.
Due to customer concerns, the claim was escalated to a senior adjuster for further review and negotiation.
After review, the claim was approved with an increased settlement offer satisfying the customerâ€™s concerns.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to cover the vehicle repairs as agreed upon.
The claim was officially closed after the payment was delivered and all parties confirmed resolution.
